item.title: About
item.dc:creator: azntve
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row padding="0" ts_row_break_parents="4" ts_row_zindex="0" ts_row_min_height="100" ts_row_parallax_type="up" ts_row_parallax_speed="20" enable_mobile="false" padding_top="30" padding_bottom="30" ts_row_bg_position="top" ts_row_bg_size_standard="cover" ts_row_bg_size_parallax="150%" ts_row_bg_repeat="no-repeat" margin_left="0" margin_right="0" gradient_angle="0" gradient_color_start="#cccccc" gradient_start_offset="0" gradient_color_end="#cccccc" gradient_end_offset="100" video_mute="true" video_loop="false" video_start="false" video_stop="true" video_controls="true" video_raster="false" animation_scroll="false" animation_speed="2000"][vc_column width="1/1"][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]

Be Open and Open Source

We are about building a new kind of data store: a zero administration data store that is massively scalable and dead simple to use. We have a strong open source background, mainly through Plone and Zope. We believe that open software is better software, and we have seen time and time again how openness enables organizations to achieve extraordinary outcomes with their data. OPEN SOURCE. Crate’s ability to rapidly build and ship innovative software owes a great deal to the availability of high-quality open-source software that is freely available to integrate as components of larger works. A few high profile modules power various pieces of our technology stack, namely Lucene, Netty, Elasticsearch and Facebook Presto. Crate.IO delivers its software as Open Source, accessible at public open source repository on GitHub. Going forward, we will continue to release open source components of our software and make them available to the public.

Why we built Crate

Crate.IO was founded in 2013 by Jodok Batlogg, Christian Lutz and Bernd Dorn. Our prior experience was all about working with large data sets and setting up the elements to support them. Our experience taught us to pay attention to ease of use, from simple installation to painless operation of huge clusters. Data stores should be simple for developers to use. Big Data mountains grow everywhere. Yet it is still difficult to design, develop and operate back-end services that truly scale. Underlying traditional databases don’t scale well; solutions are  expensive. There is a human factor at play, too. Finding devops personnel with extended cluster management and big data experience is difficult and costly. We offer a cluster software stack for querying, storing and searching the world’s information. We support many kinds of data including structured, unstructured, relational, temporal and geospatial, and Crate Data REALLY scales well. Our product is built with a focus on scalability, ease of use, collaboration and integration. Crate is already deployed in e-commerce, startup, mobile app, automotive and internet of things companies, and is spreading rapidly. We are deeply passionate about building great software and a successful company.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column width="1/3"][vc_single_image image="2288" img_link_target="_self" css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]Jodok Batlogg, Founder and CEO jodok@crate.io P +43 664 9636963 Jodok has deep experience and wide recognition for his expertise in open source and big data. He is the former CTO at StudiVZ (Germany’s Facebook), the former CTO at Sevenload and CEO of Lovely Systems. He is also a director of the Plone & Zope foundations. Jodok loves his skis and his chainsaw and is an adventurous eater.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/3"][vc_single_image image="2289" img_link_target="_self" css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]Christian Lutz, Founder and COO christian@crate.io P +43 676 5 000 144 Christian is a successful builder of software companies, including enterprise delivery platforms and big consumer portals. He was co-Founder and COO of the Impossible Project (owner of the last Polaroid factory; bringing Instant Photography back), CEO of ucp morgen, SVP Qpass Inc, CEO at uboot.com & sms.at and President Fatfoogoo. Christian is a serial entrepreneur, freerider and mountaineer at heart.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/3"][vc_single_image image="2290" img_link_target="_self" css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]Bernd Dorn, Founder and CTO bernd@crate.io   Bernd is Crate’s hardcore architect and hacker with more than a decade of experience in distributed systems, enterprise data store solutions and open source. Before Crate Bernd led the technical team of Lovely systems, building big data solutions for many enterprises. Whatever Bernd starts he excels in, be it kite surfing, tennis, building his house or designing Crate.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column width="1/1"][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]

Board of Directors:

In addition to Jodok Batlogg and Christian Lutz, our Board of Directors consists of:[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/3"][vc_single_image image="2384" img_link_target="_self" css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]Nikolaj Nyholm is a partner at Sunstone and the quintessential university dropout turned technology entrepreneur. At Sunstone, Nikolaj has invested in open source, gaming and web service companies with engagements in Neo Technology, Podio, MakieLab and Seriously to mention a few. Nikolaj joined Sunstone in 2010 from image recognition company Polar Rose (acquired by Apple), and previously founded Speednames/Ascio (acquired by Group NBT); Imity (acquired by Zyb/Vodafone); and Organic Network, a now-defunct Wi-Fi startup whose legacy is OpenWRT.org, the leading open source Wi-Fi project.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/3"][vc_single_image image="2385" img_link_target="_self" css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]Gil Dibner joined DFJ Esprit after eight years of venture capital experience in the United States, Europe, and Israel. Prior to DFJ Esprit, Gil helped lead Index Venture’s seed investment activity in their London office, working with companies across Europe, the US, and Israel. Before joining Index, Gil was a principal with Gemini Israel Ventures, a $200M venture capital fund based in Tel Aviv. There, he led investments in The Gifts Project (acquired by Ebay), JFrog, and LoyalBlocks. Prior to that, as a principal at Genesis Partners, also based in Tel Aviv, Gil was very actively involved in a number of investments including Yedda (acquired by AOL), Innovid, SiSense, and Profitect.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/3"][vc_single_image image="2387" img_link_target="_self" css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]Tom Peruzzi, Founder of @aicooma, advisor to different digital startups in Mid Europe and Russia, micro-investor in cool digital stuff delivers strong business and tec background. Tom started and built aicooma, an operations consulting company for digital and media in Europe with all major players as customers, with an exit in 2011. He then successfully invested in several companies (avocadostore, vater hostcom, gpixs360) and helped them build business, adequate technology and grow. As interim CTO Tom helped building one of the first commercial IoT devices in Europe.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column width="1/1"][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]

Investors:

[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/2"][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"] Sunstone Capital Headquartered in Copenhagen, Sunstone Capital is an early-stage Life Science and Technology venture capital company investing in European start-up companies with strong potential to achieve global success in their markets. Since our establishment in 2007, we have built a strong portfolio currently totaling 50 companies and have completed several successful trade sales and IPOs. With approximately EUR 700 million in funds under management, Sunstone is today one of the leading and most active independent venture capital investors in the European and Nordic market.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/2"][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"] DFJ Esprit DFJ Esprit, member of the The DFJ Network of Partner Funds is a unique global venture capital model providing global reach through local presence. It encompasses over 140 venture capital professionals, in more than 30 cities throughout the US, Asia (including China and India), Europe, Israel, South America, and Russia, with more than 600 portfolio companies funded and over $7 billion of capital under management. DFJ Esprit is a single team of partners all of whom benefit from and contribute to the success of our investments. We are entrepreneurs ourselves and we are proud to have built our firm to its current size and are passionate about continually moving forward, which means backing winning companies and doing everything we can to help them achieve and exceed their ambitions.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: Pricing
item.dc:creator: azntve
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column width="1/1"][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]Crate.IO is OPEN SOURCE and can be used in the Community Edition (on github) for free, even if you use it commercially. We’ll support you here. Check out the Apache 2.0 license. We currently offer a simple Startup support option for productive deployments. The concept is that Crate support is priced per Cluster. Use any number of nodes that makes sense for your use-case, usually more is better.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]

STARTUP LICENSE

  • $ 12.000 / € 12.000 per year
  • Run your cluster with unlimited nodes
  • Onboarding session (video conf) with one of our core dev´s & architects to discuss your project, data structure, migration, hardware sizing etc.
  • Cluster Notification Service (SMS and email)
  • Support via dedicated Hipchat Channel
  • Support Email – guaranteed email ticket support (max 48 hours)
  • Support Phone – scheduled phone call (one per quarter)
  • Cluster Notification Service (SMS and email)
Qualification:
  • Up to $5M USD in annual revenue
  • Up to $10M USD in funding
  • Please contact us to enroll / check your qualification
[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]

BUSINESS AND ENTERPRISE LICENSE

Use our experience in managing large datasets including regarding SLAs, support, features, integration and more. We’ll help you build and operate a super-fast and super-reliable big data cluster with 24/7 support.[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/2"][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]

Enterprise License will feature on top of the Open Source product:

  • Commercial License
  • Commercial SLA´s
  • Full blown “point in time recovery”
  • Encryption
  • Cross Data Center Replication
  • Multi-Tenancy
  • Availability of initial features in Q1.2015
[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/2"][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]

Enterprise License Service included:

Above STARTUP LICENSE plus:
  • Phone 24×7 on tier 1 issues
  • Email 24×7 on tier 1 issues
  • Unlimited incidents
  • Emergency patches
[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]

Please get in contact with us, we are eager to talk to you

Get the full set of features of the Enterprise License with business and enterprise level support. Contact us for pricing.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.content:encoded:
We are not asking you to give us your copyright, but we need to get your OK to distribute and potentially relicense your code without restriction. So please make sure you have signed our contributor agreement, please select the appropriate description of yourself:
  • Individual Contributor
  • Company having employes contributing
  • Individual Corporate Contributor under an existing company contributor agreement (your employer)
All contributors of Crate have signed a CLA, thats how we can assure the users of Crate about the origin and continuing existence of the code. You only need to sign the CLA once.

item.title: Thanks dstufft
item.dc:creator: roni
item.content:encoded:
Thanks dstufft,

Before we took over crate.io, Donald Stufft started to build a PyPI alternative named Crate.

Luckily he's now a PyPI administrator and fully focussing on PyPI and pip.

We're still seeing some requests to paths like /packages/<foo>/ and redirect them to the proper location on pypi. We'll keep those redirects as long we see some traffic.

Jodok, for the Crate Team

item.title: Developers
item.dc:creator: roni
item.content:encoded:
Horizontally scaling applications

We decided to start Crate because we were unsatisfied with the way we had to build large applications. At the end of the day distributed, shared nothing architectures are the only way to go for larger environments. We love the Cloud and the possibility to spawn instances as needed. But most of the time your application will be I/O bound and large amounts of Data will be hard to move around. You can fulfil application needs by combining key/value stores, document databases, queues and search engines. No matter whether you go for an DevOps or Developers / SysOps approach - your team is having a hard time to keep on pace with all the different technologies.

Hold on, what do we really need?

When it comes to implement a horizontally scalable application, the persistence layer needs a way to...
  1. ... store documents
  2. ... store blobs
  3. ... find them again
  4. ... analyze gathered information
  5. ... react to change
There is a tremendous amount of products out there which we could glue together in order to achieve the above needs. For example:
  • MongoDB (1., 3., 4., 5.?) + Elasticsearch (3.) + GridFS (2)
  • Riak (1., 3., 4.?, 5.?) + Solr (3.) + Rados (2)
  • CouchDB (1., 4) + Elasticsearch (3.) + HDFS (2.) + Hadoop (4., 5.)
.. but what if you don't want to glue at all?

 Use CRATE instead of Glue!

Storing Documents ...

... is a built in functionality of Lucene, Crate.IO focuses on lacking durability needs like dump/restore for major version upgrades or timemachine like recovery which brings PITR to the next level.

Storing blobs ...

... is done transparently with the Crate blob implemetation, which is built on the elasticsearch cluster semantics for distribution, replication and allocation. It simply stores blobs directly on the user-space filesystem.

Finding Documents ...

... there is Lucene and Elasticsearch under the hood - nothing else to say.

Analyse your data in realtime ...

... with the enhanced aggregation functionality provided by custom facets. Besides the already huge amount of built-in and 3rd-party facets of elasticsearch, CRATE provides additional generic grouping and sorting facets to provide SQL like "group by ... having .." and "order by" functionality.

Reacting to change ...

... via "QUERY into". Remember the good old days ... restructuring the whole relational database with a single SQL script? Crate implements that functionality by borrowing the ability to put the result of a query directly into one or more indexes or even to other clusters. This requirement becomes even more eminent on document based databases, where data is often stored highly denormalized.

item.title: 概要
item.dc:creator: roni
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row padding="0" ts_row_break_parents="4" ts_row_zindex="0" ts_row_min_height="100" ts_row_parallax_type="up" ts_row_parallax_speed="20" enable_mobile="false" padding_top="30" padding_bottom="30" ts_row_bg_position="top" ts_row_bg_size_standard="cover" ts_row_bg_size_parallax="150%" ts_row_bg_repeat="no-repeat" margin_left="0" margin_right="0" gradient_angle="0" gradient_color_start="#cccccc" gradient_start_offset="0" gradient_color_end="#cccccc" gradient_end_offset="100" video_mute="true" video_loop="false" video_start="false" video_stop="true" video_controls="true" video_raster="false" animation_scroll="false" animation_speed="2000"][vc_column width="1/1"][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]

クレートデータ（Crate）:簡単にリアルタイムSQLデータ保存を拡張

拡張可能シンプル高速

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]Crate は、何も共有せず、フルに検索可能、ドキュメント指向クラスター型データ保存です： データ集中処理型のアプリ、モノのインターネット、あるいはリアルタイム分析用の高速かつパワフルな大量の拡張可能なバックエンド。100％オープンソースです。 Crate.IO は、SQLを利用してアクセスできる強力な検索（ライブラリーが含まれたElasticsearch）のあるNoSQLドキュメントデータベースのメリットでデータを保存します。[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]

パワフルかつ超高速

Crate は、表形式データ、半構造のレコード及びバイナリ―オブジェクト(Blobs)用の1つのパワフルなバックエンドです。それは極めて有用で、何十億ものレコードに1秒以下での対応を可能にしており、リアルタイムの大量平行アクセスを提供します。

ゼロ管理

全てのCrate.IO ノードは同じです。商品ハードウエア、またはクラウド上でノードを追加するのは、端末上での1つのコマンドラインと同様にシンプルです。Crate Dataクラスターは自己設定かつ自己回復型です。

Crateを利用する理由？

Crate は拡張可能なリアルタイムのソリューションであり、大きなコスト効果の優位性をもらたします。Crate.IO はリレーショナルSQL (例、MySQL)、NoSQL (例、MongoDB)そして検索(Lucene/ES)を組み合わせたユニークなポジションを占めています。

何も共有しないアーキテクチャー

高速かつ簡単に利用可

1秒以下で読み込みと書き込みを行うためにSQLを利用します。

高い利用可能性

Crateクラスターは永続性、回復性があります。失敗したノードは削除され、新たなノードが追加されます。[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]

CRATE VS.一連のテクノロジー

Crate.IO は、データ集中型のバックエンドを持つ開発者が文書、blobを保存し、リアルタイム検索をサポートするために、いくつかの技術を「接着する」必要が無くなるよう、構築されました。当社は、開発者が良い形で大量の非正規化データ保存の維持を行うために必要とされる微調整、断片作業、複製そしてその他の操作に伴う手作業を行わなくともよくなるようにもしたかったのです。当社は、誰もが1つのマシーン、多くのマシーン、またはクラウド上で利用できるシンプルで故障の無い大量の拡張可能なデータ保存を望んでいました。 データ集中型のアプリ用のデータ保存は永続的かつ水平に拡張可能であり、以下の5つの要件をサポートする必要があります： (1) 文書保存、(2) blob、(3) 再度それを見つける、(4) クエリを動作させる（分析）、そして(5) 必要時にデータ構造に直接変更を加えることが可能。 開発者はいくつかの技術を結び付け、同じ結果にたどり着くことができなかったのでしょうか？ここに事例があります：
  • MongoDB + ElasticSearch + GridFS。GridFSはblob保存をサポートし、ElasticSearch検索を行い、MongoDBはその残りを行います。データ構造の変更を行うことは難しいかもしれませんが、拡張し、マルチノード環境は管理が難しいかもしれません。
  • Riak + Solr + Rados。blob保存用のRados、検索用のSolr、そしてその残りにRiak。これは極めて、最初のオプションに類似しており、同様にその問題をシェアします。
  • CouchDb (文書保存と分析) + ElasticSearch (検索) + HDFS (blob保存、アーカイブ化) + Hadoop (分析と変更)。このソリューションは、Hadoop及び読み込みと書き込みの重い作業負荷に対する適合性に伴う多くの問題を呈します。
自己回復かつ自己設定データ保存をサポートしつつ、こうした5つの要件にCrate がいかに対処するのかを見ていきましょう。
  1. 文書保存 CrateはLuceneとElasticSearchの機能性で構築により、文書データを保存します。Crateは、次期レベルへの時宜を得た回復をもたらすメジャーバージョンアップグレードに対してダンプ/回復の機能性を加えています。
  2. Blob保存 Blob保存はCrate blob展開を利用し、透明性のある形で行われ、配布、複製及び割り当てに対するelasticsearchクラスターの意味論において構築されています。それはユーザスペースでのファイルシステム上で直接、シンプルにblobを保存します。
  3. 文書検索 Crateは検索にElasticsearchを利用します。それはスピードを求める場合に、かなり最善なものです。
  4. SQLを利用するリアルタイムデータ分析 Crateは分散クエリアナライザー、プランナー及び実行エンジンを通してSQLを利用するリアルタイムデータ分析を可能にします。これは「..を有する...別のグループ」と「～別に順序づける」機能性のようなSQLを提供する上級のグループとソーティングの機能性を加えます。マップ/削減、しかもリアルタイムでを考えてみてください。
  5. 全ての再度行わずに変更を行う 全体のリレーショナルデータベースを再構築することが1つのSQLスクリプトの利用により可能であった古き良き時代をご存知ですか？Crateは、1つ以上のインデックスに直接クエリの結果を出す能力を借りることによりその機能性を実行します。この要件は、でーたが極めて非正規化のフォーマットで保存されることが多い文書ベースのデータベース上でさらに著しいものとなります。

ドライバー

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]

要件

Linux、Mac OS XまたはWindows Java 7 Python (コマンドラインクラインアント用)

クライアントとツール

Crate Dataは内蔵管理インターフェース付きで出荷されます。コマンドラインのインターフェース(Crate Shell – CraSh)でインタラクティブなクエリが可能になります。CrateのPythonクライアントは最先端であり、SQLAlchemy統合を特徴とします。 Crate をダウンロードする[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column width="1/1"][rev_slider_vc alias="ui"][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: 概述
item.dc:creator: roni
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row padding="0" ts_row_break_parents="4" ts_row_zindex="0" ts_row_min_height="100" ts_row_parallax_type="up" ts_row_parallax_speed="20" enable_mobile="false" padding_top="30" padding_bottom="30" ts_row_bg_position="top" ts_row_bg_size_standard="cover" ts_row_bg_size_parallax="150%" ts_row_bg_repeat="no-repeat" margin_left="0" margin_right="0" gradient_angle="0" gradient_color_start="#cccccc" gradient_start_offset="0" gradient_color_end="#cccccc" gradient_end_offset="100" video_mute="true" video_loop="false" video_start="false" video_stop="true" video_controls="true" video_raster="false" animation_scroll="false" animation_speed="2000"][vc_column width="1/1"][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]

Crate：易于扩展的实时SQL数据存储 可扩展、简单、快速。

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]Crate 是一种无共享、完全可搜索、以文档为导向的分类数据存储：针对数据密集型应用、物联网，或者实时分析的一种快速、强大、具有大规模扩展性的后端。它是100%开源的。 Crate.IO 是一种数据存储，拥有具有强大搜索功能（如库中所包含的Elasticsearch）的NoSQL文档数据库的益处，可以使用SQL访问。[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]

强大和超级快速

Crate 是针对列表数据、半结构化记录，以及二进制对象（Blobs）的一种强大后端。它具有高度可用性并且提供实时大规模并行访问，能够对数十亿记录作出次秒级响应。

零管理

所有Crate.IO 节点都是相等的。在商用硬件或者云上添加节点就好比您的终端机上的单个命令行一样简单。Crate 群集是自动配置和自我修复的。

什么选择？

Crate Data是一种可扩展的实时解决方案，能够提供巨大的成本和效率优势。Crate 通过将关系型SQL（如，MySQL），NoSQL（如，MongoDB），和搜索（Lucene/ES）相结合而占据了一个独一无二的位置。

实时，大规模并行 无分享架构

快速，易于使用

使用SQL在次秒级响应时间内读写。

高可用性

Crate Clusters持久而有弹性。失效的节点会被删除，并添加新节点。 驱动程序 [/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]

CRATE DATA对比各种技术的大杂烩

Crate.IO 是为了让拥有数据密集型后端的开发者不再需要将多项技术“粘合”在一起以存储文件、二进制大对象，以及支持实时搜索而创建的。我们还希望能够帮助开发者们避开保持非标准化大数据存储的良好状态所需的与调谐、分区、复制，以及其它操作相关的手动作业。我们想要的是一种简单、容错，以及大规模可扩展的数据存储，人人都可以在单部机器、多部机器，或者在云上使用。   针对数据密集型应用的数据存储必须能够持久、横向可扩展，并且支持以下五个要求： （1）存储文档，（2）二进制大对象，（3）再次找到它们（4）运行查询（分析）和（5）在需要时能够对数据结构进行简单的更改。   开发者们将多种技术结合在一起不能获得相同的结果吗？以下为一些例子：
  • MongoDB + ElasticSearch + GridFS。GridFS 可以支持二进制大对象存储，ElasticSearch支持搜索，而MongoDB则会完成剩余的任务。但是，可能会很难对数据结构作出更改，并且，还可能会很难管理缩放和多节点环境。
  • Riak + Solr + Rados。Rados 用于二进制大对象存储，Solr用于搜索，而Riak完成剩余任务。这与第一个选项非常相似，同时也会遇到同样的问题。
  • CouchDb（文档存储和分析） + ElasticSearch（搜索）+ HDFS（二进制大对象存储，归档）+ Hadoop（分析和更改）。这种解决方案会显现许多关于Hadoop及其对繁重的读取工作负荷的适合性的问题。
让我们来看看Crate Data是如何在支持自我修复和自动配置数据存储的同时应对这五个要求的。
  1. 存储文档 Crate 通过内建Lucene 和 ElasticSearch功能存储文档。Crate会为重要版本升级添加清除/恢复功能，为下一个级别提供基于时间点的恢复。
  2. 存储二进制大对象
二进制大对象存储是使用Crate二进制大对象工具在不被察觉的情况下完成的，这种工具是建立在用于分布、复制，以及分配的elasticsearch 集群语义的基础上的。它会简单地将二进制大对象直接存储在用户空间文件系统中。
  1. 查找文件 Crate使用Elasticsearch进行搜索– 这几乎是最快速的搜索技术。
  2. 使用SQL的实时数据分析 Crate使用SQL通过分布式查询分析程序、计划程序，以及执行引擎进行实时数据分析。这将添加先进的分组和排序功能，向SQL提供诸如“按拥有…的…分组”和“以…排序”的功能。想象一下映射/减少，但却是实时的。
  3. 不用重做一切便可进行更改
还记得过去可以通过使用单个SQL脚本重组整个关系型数据库的美好时光吗？Crate通过借用将查询结果直接放入一个或多个索引中的能力实现了这种功能。这种要求对于基于文档的数据库来说甚至更加显著。在这种数据库中，数据常常是以一种高度非标准化的格式存储的。[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]

要求

Linux，Mac OS X或者Windows Java 7 Python （针对命令行客户端）

客户端和工具

Crate Data产品中包含一个内建管理界面。使用命令行界面（Crate Shell -  CraSh ）可以进行互动式查询。Crate的Python客户端是最先进的，它整合了SQLAlchemy。 下载Crate[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column width="1/1"][rev_slider_vc alias="ui"][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: Обзор
item.dc:creator: roni
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row padding="0" ts_row_break_parents="4" ts_row_zindex="0" ts_row_min_height="100" ts_row_parallax_type="up" ts_row_parallax_speed="20" enable_mobile="false" padding_top="30" padding_bottom="30" ts_row_bg_position="top" ts_row_bg_size_standard="cover" ts_row_bg_size_parallax="150%" ts_row_bg_repeat="no-repeat" margin_left="0" margin_right="0" gradient_angle="0" gradient_color_start="#cccccc" gradient_start_offset="0" gradient_color_end="#cccccc" gradient_end_offset="100" video_mute="true" video_loop="false" video_start="false" video_stop="true" video_controls="true" video_raster="false" animation_scroll="false" animation_speed="2000"][vc_column width="1/1"][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]

Crate: хранилище данных SQL с легким масштабированием в реальном времени

Масштабируемость. Простота. Быстрота.

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]Crate - это неразделяемое, документо-ориентированное кластерное хранилище данных с возможностью поиска: быстрый и мощный массивно-масштабируемый сервер для приложений с обработкой больших объемов данных, Интернета вещей или анализа в режиме реального времени. Это приложение со 100% открытым исходным кодом. Crate.IO является хранилищем данных, обладающей преимуществом документо-ориентированной базы данных NoSQL, мощным поиском (Elasticsearch включен в качестве библиотеки), использованием SQL.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]

Мощный и сверхбыстрый

Crate - это единый мощный сервер для табличных данных, полуструктурированных записей и двоичных объектов (BLOBs). Приложение является высоко доступным и предлагает массово-параллельный доступ в реальном времени, позволяя отвечать на миллиарды записей меньше чем за секунду.

Нулевое администрирование

Все узлы Crate.IO являются равными. Добавление узлов в стандартное оборудование или облако выполняется также просто, как ввод одной командной строки в терминале. Кластер Crate имеет функции самонастройки и самовосстановления.

Почему Crate?

Crate.IO - это масштабируемое решение в реальном времени, которое предлагает большие преимущества стоимости и эффективности. Crate заняло уникальное место, объединив SQL (например, MySQL), NoSQL (например, MongoDB) и поиск (Lucene/ES).

МАССОВО-ПАРАЛЛЕЛЬНАЯ АРХИТЕКТУРА В РЕАЛЬНОМ ВРЕМЕНИ

БЫСТРО И ЛЕГКО ИСПОЛЬЗОВАТЬ

Использует SQL для чтения и записи ответов в течение менее одной секунды.

ВЫСОКАЯ ДОСТУПНОСТЬ

Кластеры Crate являются надежными и устойчивыми. Неисправные узлы удаляются, новые узлы добавляются.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]

CRATE ПО СРАВНЕНИЮ С ДРУГИМИ ТЕХНОЛОГИЯМИ

Приложение Crate.IO было создано, чтобы разработчики интенсивных серверов не нуждались в объединении нескольких технологий для хранения документов, двоичных объектов и поиска в реальном времени. Мы также хотели помочь разработчикам избежать ручной работы, связанной с настройкой, фрагментацией, репликацией и другими операциями, необходимыми для содержания большого хранилища денормализованных данных в хорошем состоянии. Мы хотели создать простое, отказоустойчивое и массивно-масштабируемое хранилище данных, которое можно использовать на одном компьютере, нескольких компьютерах или в облаке. Хранилище данных для приложений с обработкой больших объемов данных должно быть надежным, горизонтально масштабируемым и поддерживать следующие пять требований: (1) хранение документов, (2) двоичных объектов, (3) выполнение повторного поиска (4) выполнение запросов (аналитика) и (5) прямые изменения структуры данных при необходимости. Возможно, разработчики могут просто объединить несколько технологий и получить такие же результаты? Вот некоторые примеры: • MongoDB + ElasticSearch + GridFS. GridFS поддерживает хранение двоичных объектов, ElasticSearch - поиск, MongoDB будет делать все остальное. Хотя трудно изменить структуру данных, масштабировать и управлять многоузловой средой. • Riak + Solr + Rados. Rados для хранения двоичных объектов, Solr для поиска и Riak для остального. Очень похоже на первый вариант и имеет такие же проблемы. • CouchDb (хранение документов и аналитика) + ElasticSearch (поиск) + HDFS (хранение двоичных объектов, архивация) + Hadoop (аналитика и изменения). Это решение имеет множество проблем, связанных с Hadoop, а также стабильностью при большом объеме чтения и записи. Давайте посмотрим, как Crate справляется с этими 5 требованиями при одновременной поддержке самовосстановления и самонастройки хранилища данных. 1. Хранение документов Crate.IO сохраняет документы с помощью встроенной технологии Lucene и ElasticSearch. Приложение Crate добавило функции дампа/восстановления для всех крупных обновлений версий, что переводит «восстановление на определенный момент времени» на новый уровень. 2. Хранение двоичных объектов Хранение двоичных объектов выполняется прозрачно с помощью реализации двоичных объектов Crate, встроенных в семантику кластера Elasticsearch для распространения, репликации и размещения. Оно просто сохраняет двоичные объекты прямо в файловой системе пользователя. 3. Поиск документов Crate использует Elasticsearch для поиска – это лучшее из доступных скоростных средств. 4. Анализ данных в режиме реального времен с помощью SQL Crate позволяет анализировать данные в режиме реального времен с помощью SQL через анализатор, планировщик и механизм выполнения распределенных запросов. Это добавляет расширенные функции группирования и сортировки для обеспечения функциональности SQL типа “group by … having ..” и “order by”. Представьте себе MapReduce, но в реальном времени. 5. Выполнение изменений без общего переделывания Помните старые добрые времена, когда реструктуризацию всей реляционной базы данных можно было выполнить с помощью одного сценария SQL? Crate реализует эту функцию с помощью записи результата запроса прямо в один или несколько индексов. Это требование стало более необходимым в базах данных документов, где данные часто хранятся в денормализованном формате.

ДРАЙВЕРЫ

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]Требования Linux, Mac OS X или Windows Java 7 Python (для клиента командной строки) Клиенты и инструменты Crate поставляется со встроенным интерфейсом администрирования. Интерфейс командной строки (оболочка Crate – CraSh) позволяет выполнять интерактивные запросы. Клиент Python Crate является самым продвинутым и интегрируется с SQLAlchemy. Загрузить Crate[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column width="1/1"][rev_slider_vc alias="ui"][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: Vue d'ensemble
item.dc:creator: roni
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row padding="0" ts_row_break_parents="4" ts_row_zindex="0" ts_row_min_height="100" ts_row_parallax_type="up" ts_row_parallax_speed="20" enable_mobile="false" padding_top="30" padding_bottom="30" ts_row_bg_position="top" ts_row_bg_size_standard="cover" ts_row_bg_size_parallax="150%" ts_row_bg_repeat="no-repeat" margin_left="0" margin_right="0" gradient_angle="0" gradient_color_start="#cccccc" gradient_start_offset="0" gradient_color_end="#cccccc" gradient_end_offset="100" video_mute="true" video_loop="false" video_start="false" video_stop="true" video_controls="true" video_raster="false" animation_scroll="false" animation_speed="2000"][vc_column width="1/1"][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]

Crate: un datastore SQL en temps réel facilement ajustable

Ajustable. Simple. Rapide.

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]Crate est une grappe de datastores shared-nothing, intégralement interrogeables et orientés document : un backend rapide, puissant et massivement ajustable pour les applis à forte consommation de données, l’internet des objets ou les analytiques en temps réel. Cette solution est intégralement open source. Crate.IO est un datastore comportant les avantages d’une base de données orientée documents NoSQL, et intégrant une fonction de recherche puissante (Elasticsearch inclut en tant que bibliothèque), accessible en utilisant SQL.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]

Puissant et ultra rapide

Crate.IO est un backend puissant pour les données tabulaires, les dossiers semi-structurés et les objets binaires (blobs). Il offre une disponibilité élevée ainsi qu’un accès massivement parallèle en temps réel, permettant d’obtenir des temps de réponse inférieurs à la seconde sur des milliards de dossiers.

Aucune administration

Tous les nœuds de Crate sont égaux. Ajouter des nœuds sur du matériel courant ou sur le nuage est aussi simple qu’entrer une seule ligne de commande sur votre terminal. Une grappe Crate.IO est à la fois capable de s’auto-configurer et de s’auto-réparer.

Pourquoi Crate ?

Crate est une solution en temps réel ajustable, qui offre d’énormes avantages économiques et fonctionnels. Crate.IO a adopté une position unique en combinant le modèle relationnel SQL (c.-à-d. MySQL), le modèle NoSQL (c.-à-d. MongoDB) et la recherche (Lucene/ES).

MASSIVEMENT PARALLÈLE EN TEMPS RÉEL

RAPIDE ET FACILE À UTILISER

Utilise SQL pour des lectures et écritures dans des délais inférieurs à la seconde.

DISPONIBILITÉ ÉLEVÉE

Les grappes Crate sont persistantes et résistantes. Les nœuds en défaut sont supprimés, et de nouveaux nœuds sont ajoutés.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]

CRATE VS UN MÉLANGE DE TECHNOLOGIES

La solution Crate.IO a été bâtie de manière à ce que les développeurs dont le backend consomme beaucoup de données n’aient pas besoin « d’empiler » plusieurs technologies pour pouvoir stocker les documents et les blobs en plus de prendre en charge la recherche en temps réel. Nous voulions aussi éviter aux développeurs tout le travail manuel qu’impliquent le paramétrage, le sharding, la réplication et toutes les autres opérations rendues nécessaires pour maintenir en état un datastore dénormalisé volumineux. Nous avons privilégié un datastore simple, tolérant aux pannes et massivement ajustable qui peut être utilisé par n’importe qui sur une seule machine, sur plusieurs machines ou sur le nuage. Un datastore pensé à destination des applis à forte consommation de données doit être persistant, ajustable horizontalement et capable de répondre aux cinq exigences suivantes : (1) stocker les documents, (2) et les blobs, (3) retrouver ceux-ci (4) exécuter les interrogations (analytique) et (5) permettre de modifier directement la structure des données, le cas échéant. Les développeurs ne peuvent-ils pas se contenter d’empiler plusieurs technologies pour obtenir les mêmes résultats ? Voici quelques exemples : • MongoDB + ElasticSearch + GridFS. GridFS permet le stockage de blobs, ElasticSearch permet la recherche et MongoDB se charge du reste. Modifier la structure des données peut s’avérer complexe, et gérer l’ajustement et les environnements multi-nœuds s’annonce difficile. • Riak + Solr + Rados. Rados pour le stockage de blobs, Solr pour la recherche et Riak pour le reste. C’est une option très similaire à la précédente, qui présente à peu près les mêmes problèmes. • CouchDb (stockage de documents et analytique) + ElasticSearch (recherche) + HDFS (stockage de blobs, archivage) + Hadoop (analytique et modifications). Cette solution présenterait les nombreux problèmes liés à Hadoop et à son aptitude à gérer les lourdes tâches d’écriture et de lecture. Voyons comment Crate répond à ces 5 exigences, tout en permettant aussi au datastore de s’auto-configurer et de s’auto-réparer. 1. Stockage des documents Crate.IO stocke les documents par le biais des fonctionnalités incorporées de Lucene et d’ElasticSearch. Crate ajoute en plus une fonctionnalité de suppression/restauration pour les mises à niveau de version importantes, permettant ainsi d’atteindre un tout nouveau niveau de restauration temporelle. 2. Stockage de blobs Le stockage de blobs se fait en toute transparence, en utilisant l’implémentation de blobs de Crate, qui s’appuie sur la sémantique de grappe d’Elasticsearch pour la distribution, la réplication et l’allocation. Les blobs sont simplement et directement stockés sur le système de fichiers dans l’espace utilisateur. 3. Recherche des documents Crate utilise Elasticsearch pour la recherche – c’est tout simplement ce qui se fait de mieux en terme de vitesse. 4. Analytique de données en temps réel utilisant SQL Crate permet des analytiques de données en temps réel utilisant SQL par le biais de l’analyseur, planificateur et moteur d’exécution d’interrogations distribué. Celui-ci ajoute une fonctionnalité de groupage et de triage avancée afin d’offrir des fonctions similaires au « group by … having .. » et « order by » de SQL. Pensez Map/Reduce, mais en temps réel. 5. Effectuer des modifications sans avoir à tout refaire Vous vous souvenez de cette époque formidable où restructurer l’intégralité d’une base de données relationnelle était possible grâce à un seul script SQL ? Crate implémente cette fonctionnalité en empruntant la faculté de placer le résultat d’une interrogation directement dans un ou plusieurs indexes. Cette exigence prend encore plus d’importance pour les bases de données basées sur documents, dans lesquelles les données sont souvent stockées sous un format hautement dénormalisé.

Pilotes

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]Configurations requises Linux, Mac OS X ou Windows Java 7 Python (pour le client en ligne de commande) Clients et outils Crate Data est fourni avec une interface d’administration incorporée. L’interface en ligne de commande (Crate Shell – CraSh) permet des interrogations interactives. Le client Python de Crate est le plus avancé disponible et inclut l’intégration à SQLAlchemy. Téléchargez Crate Data[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column width="1/1"][rev_slider_vc alias="ui"][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: Panoramica
item.dc:creator: roni
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row padding="0" ts_row_break_parents="4" ts_row_zindex="0" ts_row_min_height="100" ts_row_parallax_type="up" ts_row_parallax_speed="20" enable_mobile="false" padding_top="30" padding_bottom="30" ts_row_bg_position="top" ts_row_bg_size_standard="cover" ts_row_bg_size_parallax="150%" ts_row_bg_repeat="no-repeat" margin_left="0" margin_right="0" gradient_angle="0" gradient_color_start="#cccccc" gradient_start_offset="0" gradient_color_end="#cccccc" gradient_end_offset="100" video_mute="true" video_loop="false" video_start="false" video_stop="true" video_controls="true" video_raster="false" animation_scroll="false" animation_speed="2000"][vc_column width="1/1"][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]

Crate: archivio di dati SQL in tempo reale e facilmente espandibile

Espandibile. Semplice. Veloce.

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]Crate è un archivio di dati in cluster con architettura shared nothing, completamente ricercabile, e progettato per documenti: un backend veloce e potente, altamente scalabile per le applicazioni ad alta intensità di dati, l’Internet degli Oggetti o l’analisi in tempo reale. È al 100% open source. Crate.IO è un archivio di dati con i benefici di un DB documentale NoSQL con una funzionalità di ricerca potente (Elasticsearch come biblioteca inclusa), accessibile utilizzando SQL.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]

Potente e Velocissimo

Crate è un backend potente per dati tabulari, record semistrutturati e oggetti binari (Blob). È altamente disponibile e offre grande accesso parallelo in tempo reale, consentendo risposte sotto il secondo per miliardi di record.

Zero Amministrazione

Tutti i nodi di Crate.IO sono uguali. Aggiungere nodi su commodity hardware o cloud è semplice come una singola riga di comando sul tuo terminale. Un cluster di Crate è auto-configurazione e si auto-ripara.

Perchè Crate?

Crate.IO è una soluzione espandibile in tempo reale, che offre grandi vantaggi in termini di costi ed efficienza. Crate ha presto l’approccio esclusivo di combinare un dB relazionale SQL (es MySQL), NoSQL (es MongoDB) e la Ricerca (Lucene/ES).

IN TEMPO REALE, ENORMEMENTE PARALLELO

VELOCE, FACILE DA USARE

Usa SQL per leggere e scrivere con tempo di risposta sotto il secondo.

ALTA DISPONIBILITA’

I Cluster Crate sono persistenti e resistenti. I nodi che falliscono vengono rimossi e nuovi nodi vengono aggiunti.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]

CRATE CONTRO UN MISCUGLIO DI TECNOLOGIE

Crate è stato costruito in modo che gli sviluppatori con un back-end dei dati trafficato non debbano “incollare” assieme diverse tecnologie per archiviare documenti, blob e supportare la ricerca in tempo reale. Volevamo anche aiutare gli sviluppatori a evitare il lavoro manuale associato con la sintonizzazione, frammentazione, replica e altre operazioni necessarie per mantenere un grande archivio di dati de-normalizzato in buona forma. Volevamo un archivio dati semplice, che tollerasse i guasti e altamente scalabile che chiunque potesse utilizzare, su una singola macchina, molte macchine o sul cloud. Un archivio di dati per le applicazioni ad alta intensità di dati ha bisogno di essere persistente, scalabile orizzontalmente e sostenere questi cinque requisiti: (1) archiviare documenti, (2) blobs, (3) trovarli di nuovo (4) lanciare query (analisi) e (5) consentire di apportare modifiche semplici nella struttura dati, se necessario. Non potrebbero gli sviluppatori semplicemente incollare insieme diverse tecnologie e ottenere gli stessi risultati? Ecco alcuni esempi:
  • • MongoDB + ElasticSearch + GridFS. GridFS supporterebbe archivio blob, ElasticSearch la ricerca e MongoDB farebbe il resto. Creare dei cambi nella struttura dati potrebbe essere difficile però e scalarli e trattare ambienti multi nodo potrebbe rendersi difficile da gestire.
  • • Riak + Solr + Rados. Rados per archivio blob, Solr per le ricerche e Riak per il resto. Questo è molto simile alla prima opzione e ne condivide i problemi.
  • • CouchDb (archivio documenti e analisi) + ElasticSearch (ricerca) + HDFS (archivio blob, archiviazione) + Hadoop (analisi e cambi). Questa soluzione avrebbe molti dei problemi associati ad Hadoop e con la sua idoneità a pesanti carichi di lettura e scrittura.
  Vediamo come Crate.IO affronta questi 5 requisiti, supportando anche un archivio dati con auto-riparazione e auto-configurazione. 1. Memorizzazione Documenti Crate memorizza i documenti con la funzionalità interna di Lucene e ElasticSearch. Crate aggiunge la funzionalità di dump/restore per gli aggiornamenti alle versioni maggiori e questo porta il recupero di un punto preciso nel tempo al livello successivo. 2. Memorizzazione Blob La memorizzazione Blob è fatta in modo trasparente, utilizzando l'implementazione blob di Crate, che è basata sulla semantica del cluster elasticsearch per la distribuzione, la replica e l'allocazione. Memorizza semplicemente i blob direttamente nell’area utente del file system. 3. Ricerca Documenti Crate usa Elasticsearch per la ricerca – è davvero il meglio esistente come velocità. 4. Analisi in tempo reale usando SQL Crate consente l’analisi dei dati in tempo reale utilizzando SQL attraverso il motore di Analisi Query, il motore di pianificatore e esecuzione distribuita. Questo aggiunge funzionalità avanzate di ordinamento e raggruppamento per fornire funzionalità tipo SQL come "group by ...” e “order by". Puoi pensarlo come un Map / Reduce, ma in tempo reale. 5. Fare cambi senza dover rifare tutto Ricordate i bei tempi in cui la ristrutturare un intero database relazionale era possibile utilizzando un singolo script SQL? Crate implementa questa funzionalità prendendo in prestito la capacità di mettere il risultato di una query direttamente in uno o più indici. Questa esigenza diventa ancora più importante su database basati su documenti, dove i dati vengono spesso memorizzati in un formato altamente denormalizzato [/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]Requisiti Linux, Mac OS X o Windows Java 7 Python (per il client a linea di comando) Client e Strumenti Crate viene distribuito con una Interfaccia Amministratore. L’interfaccia a linea di comando (Crate Shell – CraSh) consente di fare query interattive. Il client Python di Crate è molto avanzato e implementa l’integrazione SQLAlchemy. Scarica Crate[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column width="1/1"][rev_slider_vc alias="ui"][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: Überblick
item.dc:creator: stephanie
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row padding="0" ts_row_break_parents="4" ts_row_zindex="0" ts_row_min_height="100" ts_row_parallax_type="up" ts_row_parallax_speed="20" enable_mobile="false" padding_top="30" padding_bottom="30" ts_row_bg_position="top" ts_row_bg_size_standard="cover" ts_row_bg_size_parallax="150%" ts_row_bg_repeat="no-repeat" margin_left="0" margin_right="0" gradient_angle="0" gradient_color_start="#cccccc" gradient_start_offset="0" gradient_color_end="#cccccc" gradient_end_offset="100" video_mute="true" video_loop="false" video_start="false" video_stop="true" video_controls="true" video_raster="false" animation_scroll="false" animation_speed="2000"][vc_column width="1/1"][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]

Crate: Verteilter Data Store mit SQL

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]

Leicht zu skalieren. Einfach. Schnell.

Crate basiert auf einer Shared-Nothing-Architektur und ist ein vollständig durchsuchbarer, dokumentenorientierter Data Store: ein schnelles, leistungsstarkes und massiv skalierbares Backend für hochverfügbare, datenintensive Anwendungen, wie Mobile- und Webapps, Internet of Things oder Echtzeit-Analysen. Crate.IO ist 100% Open Source. Crate ist ein Datenspeicher mit den Vorteilen einer NoSQL-Dokument-Datenbank mit leistungsfähiger Suche (Elasticsearch als Library enthalten) und dabei wird SQL unterstützt.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]

Leistungsstark & schnell

Crate.IO ist ein leistungsfähiges Backend für tabellarische Daten, semi-strukturierten Datensätze und binäre Objekt (BLOBs). Es ist hoch verfügbar und bietet in Echtzeit massiv parallelen Zugriff, und damit Antwortzeiten in Millisekunden, auch Milliarden von Datensätzen.

Zero Administration

Alle Knoten in einem Crate Cluster sind identisch. Das Hinzufügen oder Entfernen von Knoten (auf Standard Hardware oder in der Cloud) ist einfach, weil Crate dies automatisch erledigt. Ein Crate Daten-Cluster konfiguriert sich selbst und verfügt bei Wegfall von Knoten über eine automatische Wiederherstellung der Integrität bzw. der frei konfigurierbaren Replikas.

Warum Crate?

Crate ist eine skalierbare Echtzeit-Lösung die Daten hochverfügbar bereit stellt und große Kosten-und Effizienzvorteile bietet. Crate.IO kombiniert relationales SQL (zB MySQL) mit NoSQL (zB MongoDB) und integrierter Suche (Lucene / Elasticsearch) und hat damit eine einzigartige Position eingenommen

HOCH VERFÜGBARE SHARED-NOTHING-ARCHITEKTUR

SCHNELL UND EINFACH ZU BEDIENEN

Verwenden Sie SQL um gleichzeitig zu lesen und zu schreiben mit Reaktionszeiten unter einer Sekunde.

HOHE VERFÜGBARKEIT

Crate Cluster sind persistent und belastbar. Ausgefallenen Knoten werden automatisch entfernt und Replikationen erneuert. Neue Knoten werden automatisch hinzugefügt und erhöhen die Performance sowie die Verfügbarkeit.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]

CRATE versus einem Technologie-Mix

Crate wurde entwickelt, so dass Entwickler mit einem datenintensiven Back-End nicht mehrere Technologien zusammenmischen müssen, um Tabellen, Dokumente und Blobs zu speichern und Echtzeit-Volltextsuche zu haben. Wir vereinfachen für Entwicklern die manuelle Arbeit mit Tuning, Sharding, Replikation und anderen Operationen, die erforderlich sind um einen große de-normalisierte Datenspeicher zu betreiben. Wir wollten einen einfachen, fehlertoleranten und massiv skalierbaren Data Store, den jeder benutzen kann egal ob er auf einer einzigen Maschine, vielen Maschinen oder in der Cloud läuft. Ein Data Store für datenintensive Anwendungen muss persistent, horizontal skalierbar und hochverfügbar sein und dabei diese fünf Anforderungen erfüllen: (1) speichern von Dokumenten (Json), (2) Blobs, (3) Suche (4) Ausführen von Abfragen (Analytik) und (5) einfache Änderungen an der Datenstruktur zu ermöglichen. Aber könnten Entwickler nicht mehrere Technologien zusammenkleben und gleiche Ergebnisse erhalten? Hier sind einige Beispiele:
  • MongoDB + ElasticSearch + GridFS. GridFS als BLOB-Speicher, ElasticSearch für die Suche und MongoDB für den Rest. Dies macht Datenstruktur Veränderungen schwierig sein, Skalierung und Multiknoten-Umgebungen werden schwierig zu verwalten sein.
  • Riak + Solr + Rados. Rados als BLOB-Speicher, Solr für die Suche und für den Rest Riak. Dies ist sehr ähnlich zu der ersten Option und ebenfalls die möglichen Probleme.
  • CouchDB (document store und analytics) + ElasticSearch (Suche) + HDFS (BLOB-Speicher, Archivierung) + Hadoop (Analytik und Changes). Diese Lösung würde einige der Probleme mit Hadoop aufzeigen, speziell die fehlende Eignung für massive Workloads bei gleichzeitigem lesen und schreiben.
Wie geht Crate.IO nun mit diesen 5-Anforderungen um, bei gleichzeitiger Unterstützung von Zero-Configuration und Self-healing. 1. Speichern von Dokumenten Crate speichert Dokumente mittels der integrierten Funktionalität von Lucene und ElasticSearch. Crate ergänzt dies mit Dump / Restore-Funktionalität für große Versions-Upgrades. 2. BLOBs speichern Die Blob Speicherung erfolgt transparent mit der Crate Blob Implementierung, welche auf den Elasticsearch Cluster Semantiken für die Verteilung, Replikation und Zuordnung aufbaut. Es speichert die Blobs direkt auf dem User-Space-Dateisystem. 3. Suche nach Dokumenten Crate verwendet Elasticsearch für die Suche - das ist so ziemlich das Beste für hohe Geschwindigkeiten. 4. Echtzeit-Datenanalyse mit SQL Crate ermöglicht Echtzeit-Datenanalyse unter Verwendung von SQL durch den verteilten Query Analyzer, Planer und Execution-Engine. Zusätzlich bietet Crate erweiterte Funktionalitäten bei Gruppierung und Sortierung, um eine SQL-ähnliche  Funktionalität für "group by ... having .." und "order by" zur Verfügung zu stellen. Man kann sich das wie Map / Reduce vorstellen, aber in Echtzeit. 5. Änderungen machen, ohne alles wieder zu tun Man erinnere sich an die guten alten Zeiten, als die Umstrukturierung einer ganzen relationalen Datenbank noch durch die Verwendung eines einzigen SQL-Skripts möglich war? Crate implementiert diese Funktionalität durch die Möglichkeit, das Ergebnis einer Abfrage direkt in einen oder mehrere Indizes zu schreiben. Diese Anforderung wird noch bedeutender in document-based Datenbanken, in denen Daten oft in einem hochgradig denormalisierten Format gespeichert werden.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]Anforderungen  Linux, Mac OS X oder Windows Java 7 Python Clients und Tools Crate Data stellt ein eine integrierte Administrationsoberfläche zu Verfügung. Das Command Line Interface (Crate Shell - CraSh) ermöglicht interaktive Abfragen direkt in der Console. Der Crate Python-Client ist weit fortgeschritten und verfügt über eine SQLAlchemy Integration. Weiters gibts einen Ruby Client, Node.js Client, Java Nativeclient und JDBC Treiber, PDO und DBAL Treiber. Crate herunterladen[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column width="1/1"][rev_slider_vc alias="ui"][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: SQL for Elasticsearch
item.dc:creator: jodok
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row padding="20" el_class="intro"][vc_column width="1/2"][vc_single_image img_link_target="_self" css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0" img_size="full" image="165" alignment="center"][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/2"][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]

The speed of search and elegance of SQL: a 100% open source data store for your backend

Crate.IO has built a new breed of database to serve today’s mammoth data needs. Based on the familiar SQL syntax, Crate combines high availability, resiliency, and scalability in a distributed design that allows you to query mountains of data in realtime, not batches. We solve your data scaling problems and make administration a breeze. Easy to scale, simple to use.

Download[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row bg_color="#d4d8db" el_class="home-boxes"][vc_column width="1/3"][vc_single_image img_link_target="_self" css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0" img_size="full" image="181"][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]

Powerful and Superfast

Crate is one powerful backend for tabular data, semi-structured records and binary objects (Blobs), making your life easier. It is highly available and offers real time massively parallel access, enabling sub second responses on billions of records.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/3"][vc_single_image img_link_target="_self" css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0" img_size="full" image="182"][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]

Zero Administration

All Crate nodes are equal. Adding nodes on commodity hardware or the cloud is as simple as a single commandline on your terminal. A Crate cluster is self-configuring and self-healing, and it saves you many database management, tuning and other work[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/3"][vc_single_image img_link_target="_self" css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0" img_size="full" image="183"][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]

The Best of Everything

Crate.IO has taken a unique position combining relational SQL (eg MySQL), NoSQL (eg MongoDB) and Search (Lucene/ES).[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column width="1/1"][vc_testimonial client="Jeff Nappi, Director of Engineering" position="ClearVoice" nav_arrows="one" css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]"The fact that Crate Data uses SQL lowers the barriers to entry when using distributed search. And on top of that with Crate you get MongoDB and Elasticsearch in one scalable package" [/vc_testimonial][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row bg_color="#d4d8db"][vc_column width="2/3"][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]

Featured In

[/vc_column_text][indeed-clients group="all" limit="4" order="ASC" show="logo,link" theme="theme_1" columns="4" item_height="70" slider_set="0" items_per_slide="6" slide_speed="500" slide_pagination_speed="500" slide_opt="bullets,nav_button,autoplay,responsive,lazy_load,lazy_effect" slide_css_transition="none" order_by="date"][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/3"][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]

Awards

[/vc_column_text][vc_single_image image="2476" img_link_target="_self" css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0" img_link="http://gigaom.com/2014/06/18/crate-and-nimboxx-are-the-winners-of-the-2014-structure-launchpad-competition/"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row bg_color="#263e4d" el_class="dark"][vc_column width="1/1"][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0" el_class="crate-github"]

Crate is open source. It’s hosted, developed and maintained on GitHub

Crate Data on GitHub

Or get the source directly with the following git clone https://github.com/crate/crate.git

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column width="1/1"][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]Crate.IO is a shared-nothing, fully searchable, document-oriented cluster data store. It is also 100 % open source. We built it so developers with a data intensive back-end won’t need to “glue” several technologies together to store documents, blobs and support real-time search. We also wanted to help developers avoid the manual work associated with tuning, sharding, replication and other operations required to keep a large de-normalized data store in good shape. We wanted a simple, failure-tolerant and massively scalable data store anyone can use, on a single machine, many machines or on the cloud. Get it right here[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: Thank you
item.dc:creator: guntram
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]

Thank you and a warm

Welcome to the Crate family!

We're happy that you have decided to join, work and participate in the Crate.IO developer community . It is all about getting the feet wet, helping each other out and moving forward with your projects. We are all here to help.  Helping out is critical, that is why we think you should join our effort. Help out by engaging in the opensource movement that is powering Crate's big data developer community.

Three things you should do now:

1. Be the first to know Get the News. Learn about conferences, meet-ups, stories and updates. Add your e-mail: [gravityform id="3" name="newsletter-short"] 2. star the "crate data project" on github to keep in touch We are hosting code, discussing problems and work on github all day, every day. https://github.com/crate/crate 3. See where the action is Contribute and ask questions on http://stackoverflow.com/tags/cratedata/ via IRC channel #crate on Freenode Have fun, Guntram for @crateIO [/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]

Crate Data on GitHub

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column width="1/1"][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]Crate data works seamlessly with Python. We built it so developers with a data intensive back-end won’t need to “glue” several technologies together to store documents, blobs and support real-time search. item.title: Thanks

item.title: Thank you for your contribution!
item.dc:creator: jodok
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row padding="0"][vc_column][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]

Thank you for your contribution!

Time to give back some love :) We're using GratiPay (formerly known as GitTip) to send you a small token of our appreciation in thanks for your contributions to Crate and the community.  We'll gift you $0.80 per week, all you need to do is sign up for GratiPay, then let us know what account handle you used (Twitter, Facebook, etc.) so we can link it up.  It's super easy and only takes a second: Sign Up For GratiPay to Claim Your Reward Why $0.8? Very easy...it's all about Crate [CR8]! (You may have noticed we're using cr8.is as our URL shortener as well) Why weekly? Very easy as well. We strongly believe a community isn't a one-time thing. Help us to make the amount we give with GratiPay as high as possible. Encourage your friends to star us, fork us, and finally contribute back! Don't forget to check out our other community resources and sign up for our Google Group, it's where we're announcing all of our releases.[/vc_column_text][vc_raw_js]JTNDc2NyaXB0JTIwc3JjJTNEJTIyJTJGJTJGZ3R0cC5jbyUyRnYxLmpzJTIyJTIwZGF0YS1ncmF0aXBheS11c2VybmFtZSUzRCUyMmNyYXRlJTIyJTIwZGF0YS1ncmF0aXBheS13aWRnZXQlM0QlMjJnaXZpbmclMjIlM0UlM0MlMkZzY3JpcHQlM0U=[/vc_raw_js][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: Crate Cube: Crate.IO Play Cluster
item.dc:creator: guntram
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column width="1/1"][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]

This is our Crate Cube. Get more information here.

What is the Crate Cube?

The Crate Cube is a condensed miniaturized cluster that we’ve custom built to allow you to try out Crate without having to download or install anything! The video above shows two Crate Cubes running in an 8-node cluster configuration with Crate pre-installed in our sophisticated data broom closet*. Just click the orange button below to open the Crate Admin Console where you can explore the cluster and run queries against the sample data. The cluster is populated with tweets from the Twitter firehose which are contained in a table named “tweets”. If you click the “Console” button in the left column, you’ll be able to enter SQL queries on the data. For example, to see how many tweets are in the data store, run: 
select count(*) from tweets;
Give a few queries a try and see how easy it is to query the distributed and auto-sharded data store with SQL. * Hopefully the cleaning staff doesn’t turn out the light! Open Admin-Dashboard
[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column width="1/4"][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]

Documentation

Find an overview of all available calls and settings for Crate Data store in our documentation section on crate.io/docs/[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/4"][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]

Get Crate

Use our easy one-step command to launch Crate in a sandboxed environment and try it out here.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/4"][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]

About

Distributed by design Crate makes centralized database servers obsolete. Realtime non-blocking SQL engine with full blown search. Highly available, massively scalable yet simple to use. Find out more about CRATE here.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/4"][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]

Blog

Do you want to see our newest features, updates or just read more about Crate? Check out our blog.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: Developer Advocate / Developer Relations
item.dc:creator: jodok
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row padding="0px"][vc_column width="1/1"][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]

Developer Advocate / Developer Relations

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]

Join our Growth Team!

Crate.IO has built a new breed of database to serve today’s mammoth data needs. Based on the familiar SQL syntax, Crate combines high availability, resiliency, and scalability in a distributed design that allows you to query mountains of data in real-time, not batches. We solve your data scaling problems and make administration a breeze. Easy to scale, simple to use. We will make an impact on how large scale backends are run in the future. Our engineers work on massive scalability, new storage solutions, support for large-scale applications and new concepts for developers. We’re a technology startup backed by Sunstone Capital and DFJ Esprit and are located in the center of the startup epicenter in Berlin Kreuzberg. We have an office in San Francisco and Austria as well, expect to see the mountains now and then.

Your responsibilities:

As Developer Advocate based in Europe you promote a public presence for the Crate Open Source Software and interface with the developer community and partners who have integrated with us. Successful advocates are interested in building applications and have the ability to think about different application areas (consumer, enterprise), as well as understand software architecture and solutions. You also work closely with our team in San Francisco.

Requirements:

  • Respected by developers. You need to be able to be a credible partner in a technical conversation. Previous jobs such as one of the following: developer advocate/evangelist, developer (mobile/web/other), product manager with a developer background, sales engineer
  • Ideally you have already a great web/public presence: Github, personal page, Twitter, SlideShare/Speaker Deck
  • Technical background: Proficiency in multiple programming languages (Python, Ruby, Objective C, JavaScript, C++, etc.) and a clear desire to learn
  • Experience with platforms and mainstream programming languages
  • Familiarity with more up-to-date technologies a plus

Your personal profile:

  • A developer-lover. We live and die by developers. You should be spending as much time as possible talking to developers. You reach out and start the conversation. You find users who decided not to use Crate and talk to them too.
  • Agile. Startup marketing means working with unknowns. The product changes daily, marketing messages are invented and discarded, and just when you think you've got the right combination the world changes around you.
  • Willing to learn detail. You need to know what you’re talking about. We’re building a distributed data store where people store their data! While you probably won’t know this on the first day, you need to be interested in understanding our market, our customers, and our product.
  • A traveller and love to engage with people. We have users from all over the world. Your focus is on Europe especially the startup hubs like Berlin, London or Stockholm and you like meeting people at such events and locations.
  • A Social Media doer. We’d like to see you earning Github stargazers, attracting Twitter followers and successful blog outreach campaigns that work.
  • Devoted to measurement. You truly embrace measurement. This helps to understand the effect of what we do.
Note: if you think you fit that role, but you can not be based in Berlin - still talk to us to convince us :-)[/vc_column_text][vc_separator height="20"][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]

Job Details

Team or role: Developer Advocate
Job type: Full-time
Last updated: Dec 04, 2014
Job location(s): Berlin/Germany
[/vc_column_text][vc_separator height="20"][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]Apply now![/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: Crate Features
item.dc:creator: spanky
item.content:encoded:
Bulletproof Clustering:

Easily build fully distributed, massively parallel clusters. With automated node discovery and failed node detection you cluster can expand and heal itself automatically. With Crate you get auto-sharding, replication, and time series partitioning out of the box.

Mammoth Storage:

Linearly scalable data storage from gigabytes to petabytes.  To increase capacity simply add more nodes.  You’re only limited by your infrastructure.

BLOB Support:

Built-in support for Binary Large Objects (BLOBs) without having to add another service to your stack.  BLOBs are replicated, distributed, and stored right alongside your data.

Distributed SQL on a Shared-Nothing Architecture:

Our distributed SQL layer gives you data processing capabilities without map/reduce complexity and enables you to run advanced SQL queries in real time.

Realtime Map/Reduce:

Queries that would have previously been overwhelming are now distributed across the cluster using our Distributed Reduce component.  No need to run batch jobs to gain insight into your data anymore.

Powerful Search:

By leveraging Lucene indexing, you get powerful search and indexing capabilities such as ranked results, faceting, geo-spatial, and an array of query types, all at lightning fast speeds.

Aggregations:

Crate’s aggregations leverage the distributed model to return accurate distinct counts along with multi-index merged results, and joins using our realtime map/reduce.

Containers, Cloud, or Colo:

Run Crate in your cloud infrastructure or in your datacenter, but instead of spending millions on overpriced specialty hardware, just run your Crate cluster on commodity hardware. If you love containers as much as we do, use our official Docker image or build your own.

Scalar Operations & Regex Support:

Crate has added full regex support to our SQL queries, allowing you to construct extremely powerful queries.  Alongside regex support, the addition of the full range of scalar operations allows you to bring your queries to the next level.

Open Source:

We stand on the shoulders of established open source components and have adopted a permissive Apache 2.0 license.  Need more? We’re happy to provide Enterprise Support.

--> download Fact Sheet here

item.title: Crate Use Cases
item.dc:creator: spanky
item.content:encoded:
Get real-time answers from your huge datasets. Collect big amounts of data fast. Mix all kinds of data. Reduce expensive computing times. Quickly launch as many nodes as you want. Use it open sourced or buy support and SLAs. Crate’s speed allows new ways to think and new features to offer. Here are some samples:
  • Analyze billions of events that get logged on websites. Save computing time on the cloud (responses in seconds, not hours) and implement new features for customers or dynamic decisions on content rendering.
  • Mobile app developers – build a backend that will scale with the success of your downloads using straight-forward SQL commands and forget worrying about scalability problems. Use existing templates for iOS and Xcode.
  • Internet of things – provide a backend that constantly records sensor events of hundreds of thousands of devices. Deliver real-time responses when users access their smart home app on the web or mobile.
  • Tracking massive parallel activity of millions of users for a paywall or ad-system. Make real-time decisions, but also allow queries for long-time analysis.

item.title: Frequently Asked Questions
item.dc:creator: christian.haudum
item.content:encoded:
Q: What platform does Crate run on?

Crate is written in Java and therefore platform independent (tested on Linux systems, OSX and Windows). Crate only needs a working Java 7 virtual machine. We recommend using Oracle’s Java on OSX and OpenJDK on Linux Systems. Check out the Installation section in our documentation.

Q: How do I install Crate?

Crate is easy to install. Visit the Download page for instructions.

Q: What do I need to consider when setting up a Crate cluster?

Crate is a distributed datastore by design so in a production environment you usually have a cluster of 3 or more nodes. We at Crate.IO try to make the cluster setup as easy as possible. You can find a step-by-step guide in our documentation.

Q: Is there a limit on how many nodes a Crate cluster can have.

No. You can add as many instances as you want to the cluster. The more nodes, the more powerful the cluster gets!

Q: Is there a limit of memory I can use?

No. We recommend to set the maximum heap size so that there is still space for the file system cache. However it is not recommended to exceed a maximum heap size of 32GB, because more would disable the Java pointer compression of the JVM. For more information please check the Oracle Documentation and the Configuration section in our documentation. If you want to increase the total memory of the cluster you should to add more nodes.

Q: How can I inspect my data?

You can query your own data, the information schema and other system tables using SQL. Crate also ships with a graphical user interface - or short Admin UI - to inspect not only your data but also the current state of your cluster. It is accessible from the browser on every node on port 4200 at the URL /admin/ (e.g. http://127.0.0.1:4200/admin/ for a local installation). There is also a command line interface for Crate called crash written in Python. For installation instructions check out the Github project and read the documentation for usage.

Q: What drivers are there that I can use in my application?

Crate has drivers in several programming languages. Check out the Download page for a complete list of libraries.

Q: What is the best way to migrate my data from MongoDB to Crate?

We provide a best practice how to migration your data from MongoDB to Crate.

Q: What is the best way to migrate my data from MySQL to Crate?

We also have a best practice how to migration from MySQL to Crate.

Q: Does Crate do transactions?

No, Crate does not support transactions but does support Optimistic Concurrency Control which allows conflict resolution on the client side.

Q: Does Crate support JOINs?

Not yet. JOINs are on our roadmap and we try to do them the right way in usual quality and well performing. For a lot of use cases there are other ways to achieve the same result as with JOINs. The best way to start is to take a look at the ARRAY and OBJECT data types to denormalise your data.

Q: Does Crate have a built-in user/permission management?

No. You will need to secure your Crate installation/cluster with the administration weapons of your choice, e.g. firewall rules. You find information about that in the documentation about Multi Node Setup.
Still questions? Get in contact via IRC #crate on freenode.net, Github or Stackoverflow.

item.title: Java Software Engineer
item.dc:creator: christian.haudum
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row padding="0px"][vc_column width="1/1"][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]

Java Software Engineer

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]Crate's software engineers develop the next-generation data store, a unique combination of a powerful distributed database that can be installed, operated and programmed very easily. Our ambitions reach out to allow any developer to run and maintain a highly available backend as simple as running an app server. As a software engineer, you work on small team and directly impact the future of the product. We need our engineers to be versatile and always eager to tackle new problems as we continue to push technology forward. As a key member of a small and versatile team, you design, test, deploy and maintain software solutions in a fast paced startup based in Berlin/Germany, Dornbirn/Austria.

Your responsibilities:

Write code for the core of our new generation of distributed database, implementation of high-performance "shared-nothing" Java components, planning and development in the Scrum team.

Must have:

Extensive professional experience as developer and in programming in Java. Large scale design experience with Linux and SQL. Fun on doing new and edgy stuff.

Preferred qualifications:

A solid foundation in computer science, with strong competencies in data structures, algorithms, and software design. Experience with test driven development, asynchronous programming, Netty, Elasticsearch, Lucene, Big Data and Map Reduce (Hadoop, Hive, Presto, Pig), Datenbases (Postgres, MySql, Oracle, ...), Scrum. Crate is an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to tackle the next great challenge in distributed database technology. We will make an impact on how large scale backends are run in the future. Our engineers work on massive scalability, new storage solutions, support for large-scale applications and new concepts for developers.[/vc_column_text][vc_separator height="20"][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]

item.title: Snow Sprint 2015
item.dc:creator: tyler
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row padding="0"][vc_column width="1/1"][vc_single_image image="3401" alignment="center" img_link_target="_self" css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0" el_class="snowsprinthero"][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]Dates: 26 January—31 January, 2015 Location: Hittisau, Vorarlberg, Austria Contact: snowsprint@crate.io Mailing List: Snow Sprint[/vc_column_text][vc_separator height="20"][vc_column_text css_animation_speed="faster" css_animation_delay="0"]The team at Crate.io is beyond excited to announce Snow Sprint 2015! This event revives a long tradition of legendary Austrian Alpine events where developers from all over the world gather in a beautiful mountain setting for a one-of-a-kind hackathon, and you're invited! We'll be taking over a large mountain "hut" in the Austrian Alps with a small ski area nearby and hacking day and night on Crate. This is a great opportunity to get to know and work alongside the Crate core developers as well as meet other members of the Crate community and the larger ecosystem. We'll be posting a list of confirmed participants shortly. We hope you'll join us too! Registration is open! Fill out our form to let us know that you're interested in joining us. Space is limited and we expect to fill up very quickly, so sign up now to get onto the list early.

Topics

Our sprint topics will all be loosely centered around using Crate and a wide variety of topics have been suggested, but nothing is set in stone yet. For example:
  • Improving Crate's programming interfaces (Python, Go, Ruby, etc.)
  • Benchmarking Crate's performance
  • Docker, Weave, Mesos, or other container support
  • Improving documentation & creating tutorials
  • Hacking on Crate's core
  • Anything else that interests you about Crate!
Share your sprint topic ideas with the group on the mailing list

Details

There will be about 30 people staying directly at the sprint location as well as other people who live locally joining us during the day. The price is 300€ (plus VAT) per person and includes transportation to and from the sprint location from Dornbirn, as well as a bed, food, wifi, and some fun outdoor winter activities. Everyone is responsible for their own transportation to and from Dornbirn. If the sprint locations fills up it might be possible to arrange additional lodging nearby.

Logistics

The SnowSprint will be in a lovely mountain lodge called Leo's Hütten in the town of Hittisau, Austria. Crate will provide shuttles up into the mountains from the nearby town of Dornbirn, Austria. It is your mission to arrive in Dornbirn by Monday, January 26th. We recommend you arrive a day early so you make the most out of your sprint and combat any jetlag, but it is not required. We can help you find and book an affordable room for the night in Dornbirn if you choose this option. Map There are a few straightforward ways to get there: The closest airports are Zurich (ZRH), Munich (MUC), and the smaller Friedrichshafen Airport (FDH). Once you've landed, it will be necessary to take a train in order to get to Dornbirn, Austria, the central meeting place for the SnowSprint and Crate.io headquarters. Taking the Train: If you're coming from Zurich (west), it is easiest to take the train from Zurich Airport to St. Margrethen station (easy transfer at St. Gallen), where we will arrange transport for you from there to Dornbirn. The train from Zurich takes 1:45m and costs around 35€ each way (2nd class). It is also possible to take a different train directly to Dornbirn station, but for some reason, nobody recommends this. I think it's longer and the connections aren't convenient. If you're arriving at Munich airport, the train ride to Dornbirn is about 3 hours. If you're coming from the east, it is usually easy to find a train that comes to Dornbirn station. In our experience, most people arrive at Zurich and take the train to St. Margrethen. If you plan to drive yourself, we can help with driving directions. Make sure you have snow tires![/vc_column_text][vc_raw_html][/vc_raw_html][/vc_column][/vc_row]
